    {"instruction": "Provide an answer to the following question:", "input": "What does the text explain about SQL indexes?", "output": "The text explains that indexes are created by default for PRIMARY KEY and UNIQUE constraints in SQL."},
    {"instruction": "Provide an answer to the following question:", "input": "How can you create an index on a specific column in SQL?", "output": "To create an index on a specific column in SQL, you can use the syntax CREATE INDEX IdxName ON TableName (ColumnName)."},
    {"instruction": "Provide an answer to the following question:", "input": "What is the purpose of creating a UNIQUE index in SQL?", "output": "The purpose of creating a UNIQUE index in SQL is to ensure that all values in the indexed column are unique, preventing duplicates."},
    {"instruction": "Provide an answer to the following question:", "input": "How can you alter an index in SQL?", "output": "You can alter an index in SQL using the syntax ALTER INDEX IdxName ON TableName REBUILD."},
    {"instruction": "Provide an answer to the following question:", "input": "How do you drop an index in SQL?", "output": "To drop an index in SQL, you can use the command DROP INDEX IdxName."}
